title: Why does my NFC SIM card often fail to be detected when I swipe my phone?
answer:
Check that your SIM card supports NFC-SWP.

Check that all switches are enabled under Settings > More > NFC and that SIM 1 is selected for NFC payment.

Check that you have installed the carrier's payment app (such as those for China Mobile, China Telecom and China Unicom) and that you have correctly configured the default payment card in the app's settings.

The location of antenna in subway turnstiles may vary. When passing through a subway turnstile, try swiping your phone in a different place if your NFC SIM card is not detected. When swiping your phone on a bus, swipe your phone over the center of the card reader.

If you are using a China Mobile NFC SIM card at Shanghai Metro stations, please note that you can only swipe your SIM card on turnstiles that feature a green China Mobile label.

If your SIM card is not detected, try using another card reader or POS terminal. If your card is detected, this means that the first card reader/POS terminal is incompatible with your SIM card. Please inform us of any compatibility issues so that we can continue to enhance the NFC feature.

If you cannot pass through a subway turnstile, you may not have exited the turnstile correctly after your previous journey. If so, go to the information desk at the subway station for assistance.
